title: Beef Tallow May Soon Show Up On a Menu Near You. Here's What That Means
snippets: Beef tallow, a type of beef fat used for cooking, is becoming increasingly popular in restaurants, with an estimated 8% of menus expected to feature it within four years. Proponents highlight its flavor and potential health benefits, comparing it favorably to seed oils like canola and vegetable oil. However, nutritionists caution that animal fats like tallow contain higher levels of saturated fatty acids, which can increase cholesterol and heart disease risk. Despite this, demand for tallow is growing, with food service insights firm Technomic noting a more than 40% increase in menu mentions f
summary: Beef tallow is gaining popularity in restaurants, with projections suggesting it will appear on 8% of menus in four years due to its flavor and potential health benefits. Despite health concerns, its demand is rising, with a reported 40% increase in menu mentions.
